title: Account recovery text message is sending a wrong domain to users.

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hey,

I hope you're fine. :)

**Summary:**
When users setup Account recovery at Authentication section Hackerone sends them text message to their updated phone number with a wrong domain link.

**Description:**
When users adds phone number at Account recovery, they get a text message on their phone number, which shows "Your Hackerone account recovery phone number has been updated. If this is unexpected, please contact **supportahackerone.com**. Which is not your domain and can be bought or can be own by anyone. If a user contact to this domain and attacker have own this domain already, he can easy manipulate him/her to do something wrong with their accounts. He don't have to find another way to into the official Hackerone text messages to give his own website as Hackerone already doing it. He just have to own this domain and start manipulating users. And it also sounds very much similar "supportahackerone.com" to support.hackerone.com . Which can help him also.
 
**Steps To Reproduce:**
1. Go to Authentication section. And setup account recovery.
2. Add phone number and you'll receive a text message.

Fix:
Use support.hackerone.com instead of supportahackerone.com.

## Impact

Attacker can easily manipulate a user to do a wrong thing to his account.

Thank you,
Hope you'll fix this soon. And will response to my report nicely. :)
If you have any questions please feel free to ask me. :)

**And also my report is not really about support.hackerone.com subdomain, i know that is out of scope. But this message was sent through hackerone.com.**

**Screenshots:**

activities.message:
Hello @low-keytech, and thank you for your report.

> Attacker can easily manipulate a user to do a wrong thing to his account.

Can you expand on this?

Cheers,
@still

Hey 
@still basically what i meant to say by `Attacker can easily manipulate a user to do a wrong thing to his account.` is that when a text message is sent by @hackerone has a totally different domain that is `supportahackerone.com` instead of support.hackerone.com or hackerone.com now an attacker can simply buy the domain supportahackerone.com for around $10 and setup a complete replica of the hackerone domain or hackerone support site that is support.hackerone.com now after that if a person goes to the domain that he got in the message he can land to the fake h1 site......

the domain is still available to buy if u like i can make simpler poc by buying it but i don't see any reason to do that... yet...

thanks

Hi @still,
Thanks for the reply. :)

In this issue I have explained how a wrong domain is sent to a user in SMS by HackerOne and It effects the user who receives the SMS and as the domain is not owned by Hackerone and a mistake on Your end it will eventually caused issue to Hackerone, as the people who receives the SMS with wrong URL are HackerOne users.

Thanks, :)

Thank you for your follow-up, @low-keytech.

Are you able to send this email to people other than yourself?

Cheers,
@still

Hi, @still
Well You seems a bit confused about the issue.. I'm saying that **HackerOne** is sending a wrong domain in **message**, **not me** and as you guys are sending the wrong domain and someone can make that domain useful in spreading malware to h1 users or hacking them, not that i'm going to send that message but **hackerone** is **sending the message** with **wrong domain.**
**I think you should read my report again to check what's really going on.**

Thank you, :)

Hi, @still

When you go to `Settings>Authentication>Account Recovery` . Update your phone number you'll receive a text message on your phone. Which shows something like this. 

On iphone {F477937}


On Android {F477938}

You see this text message is giving a wrong domain to user `supportahackerone.com`.
I hope now you understand what i am trying to say. :)

Thanks, :)

Thank you for your follow-up, @low-keytech.

Reason for my question is that this seems to be an issue with your local mobile provider, which appears to convert `support@hackerone.com` to `supportahackerone.com` along the way, as the messages are being sent with `support@hackerone.com` in them. Can you try with a number on another provider?

Cheers,
@still

Thank you for your follow-up @still,

`Can you try with a number on another provider?`
I thought the same when I got the text first time, I already have checked this with another mobile provider, with a different phone number. As you can see the Iphone screenshot above (Attached below). This message I got, was with a new account, on a different phone number. I think you can fix this as `support.hackerone.com`.

Thanks. :)
I hope you'll fix this. :)

Hi, @still

If you think your end is good, then Users like me can get infected by this, so I think instead of using `support@hackerone.com` sign, you should use `support.hackerone.com` in phone text messages,this can solve the problem. I hope you understand and will proceed. :)

Thanks,
@low-keytech, I confirmed on my own mobile number that the SMS contains `support@hackerone.com`, not `supportahackerone.com`; this appears to be a localized issue, and will need further assessment.

Hi, @still
This looks like a localized issue at my end, then what should user like me do? We cannot change our phone numbers, a person who is new on Hackerone and don't know about his localized issue, still can get infected by this . If you change this as `support.hackerone.com`, I think everything will be good. :)

Thanks, Hope you'll think on this. :)

Hi @bencode, Thanks for the reply :)
>Do you normally see any other characters being removed/replaced?

No, just this one `@`.

Thanks, :)
Thanks again for bringing this to our attention, @lowkey-tech! Happy hacking!

Thank you so much. <3
Hi, If you don't mind can I get some Hackerone stickers. I love Hackerone stickers. Only if you don't mind. Just requesting. :)

Thanks Again, <3 :)

@lowkey-tech thanks we've deployed a fixed to remove the `@` in the text messages. Let's revisit the swag on your next report 😀

Thanks for your help!
